item.title: Code the Future with Java and AI â€“ Join Me at JDConf 2025
item.description: Wednesday, April 9, 2025 â€“ 8:30 AM PDT ğŸ‘‰ RSVP now: jdconf.com JDConf 2025 is around the corner â€“ and I want you to be part of it. Whether you are a Java developer, architect, team leader, or decision maker, this is your moment. Join us as we explore how Java is evolving with the [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com//code-the-future-with-java-and-ai-join-me-at-jdconf-2025

item.title: Azure Developer CLI (azd) â€“ April 2025
item.description: This post announces the April release of the Azure Developer CLI (azd). Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/azure-sdk/azure-developer-cli-azd-april-2025

item.title: Hola, Spain Central! Microsoft Dev Box Expands in Europe
item.description: You asked, we built it. Weâ€™re thrilled to announce that Spain Central is now a supported region for Microsoft Dev Box! ğŸ‰ Thatâ€™s right â€” starting today, you can spin up Dev Boxes in Spain Central and get all the benefits of fast, secure, ready-to-code workstations, now closer to your European teams and data. To [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/develop-from-the-cloud/hola-spain-central-microsoft-dev-box-expands-in-europe

item.title: Using OpenAIâ€™s Audio-Preview Model with Semantic Kernel
item.description: OpenAIâ€™s gpt-4o-audio-previewÂ is a powerful multimodal model that enables audio input and output capabilities, allowing developers to create more natural and accessible AI interactions. This model supports both speech-to-text and text-to-speech functionalities in a single API call through the Chat Completions API, making it suitable for building voice-enabled applications where turn-based interactions are appropriate. In this [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/semantic-kernel/using-openais-audio-preview-model-with-semantic-kernel

item.title: Automatically generate any doc comment for C++ functions in Visual Studio
item.description: Have a difficult time documenting your C++ code? Spending too much time thinking of what a function and its parameters accomplish when generating documentation? Copilot is now integrated into C++ doc comments to automatically provide documentation suggestions based on the functionâ€™s contents in Visual Studio 2022 17.14 Preview 2. To learn more about this feature, [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/cppblog/automatically-generate-any-doc-comment-for-c-functions-in-visual-studio

item.title: Microsoft 365 Certification control spotlight: Data access management
item.description: Read how Microsoft 365 Certification ensures data access management best practices for Microsoft 365 apps, add-ins, and Copilot agents. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/microsoft365dev/microsoft-365-certification-control-spotlight-data-access-management

item.title: Your Pluralsight Benefit Just Got Better
item.description: Â As I talk with Visual Studio developers about the learning and skilling benefits included in their subscription, one thing I hear often is: â€œI wish I had more time to actually use Pluralsight.â€ Starting today, Iâ€™m pleased to share that weâ€™re doing something about that. Weâ€™ve extended access to Pluralsight for all Visual Studio [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/vss-pluralsight-2025

item.title: CDN Domain URL change for Agents in Pipelines
item.description: Introduction We have announced the retirement of Edgio CDN for Azure DevOps and are transitioning to a solution served by Akamai and Azure Front Door CDNs. This change affects Azure DevOps Pipelines customers. This article provides guidance for the Azure DevOps Pipelines customers to check if they are impacted by this change in CDN and [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/devops/cdn-domain-url-change-for-agents-in-pipelines

item.title: Dev Proxy v0.26 with improved mocking, plugin validation, and Docker support
item.description: The latest version of Dev Proxy brings improved validation, plugin reliability, a brand-new Docker image and more. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/microsoft365dev/dev-proxy-v0-26-with-improved-mocking-plugin-validation-and-docker-support

item.title: Announcing Windows Community Toolkit v8.2
item.description: Announcing Windows Community Toolkit v8.2 Weâ€™re happy to announce that version 8.2 is available today! Itâ€™s an incremental update which contains a variety of improvements, made possible again with the support and contributions of our developer community. ğŸ‰ If youâ€™re not familiar with the Windows Community Toolkit, see below here! Or download our Sample Gallery [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/ifdef-windows/announcing-windows-community-toolkit-v8-2

item.title: TFVC Policies Storage Updates
item.description: TFVC Check-In Policies TFVC projects can have check-in policies such as Build (Require last build was successful), Work Item (Require associated work item), Changeset comments policy (Require users to add comment to their check-in), etc. We are changing the way we store these policies on the server. This change will slightly affect TFVC users since [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/devops/tfvc-policies-storage-updates

item.title: Microsoft partners with Anthropic to create official C# SDK for Model Context Protocol
item.description: Microsoft is collaborating with Anthropic to create an official C# SDK for the Model Context Protocol (MCP). MCP has seen rapid adoption in the AI community, and this partnership aims to enhance the integration of AI models into C# applications. The SDK is being developed as an open-source project in the modelcontextprotocol GitHub organization, making [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com//microsoft-partners-with-anthropic-to-create-official-c-sdk-for-model-context-protocol

item.title: Adding delays to our task sequencer, part 1
item.description: Not so fast there. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20250402-00/?p=111040

item.title: Important Update: Server Name Indication (SNI) Now Mandatory for Azure DevOps Services
item.description: Earlier this year, we announced an upgrade to our network infrastructure and the new IP addresses you need to allow list in your firewall â€“ Update to Azure DevOps Allowed IP addresses â€“ Azure DevOps Blog. This is our second blog post to inform you that starting from April 23rd, 2025, we will be requiring [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/devops/sni-mandatory-for-azdo-services

item.title: Modernizing push notification API for Teams
item.description: Push Notification Hub is an essential internal service that plays a crucial role in the messaging and calling flows within Teams and other platforms. This article describes its recent overhaul, which has significantly enhanced its performance and reduced latencies in delivering push notifications to user devices Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/modernizing-push-notification-api-for-teams

item.title: Microsoft Graph APIs for permanent deletion of mailbox items now available
item.description: Weâ€™re happy to announce the general availability (GA) of the permanent delete APIs for contacts, messages, and events as well as for contact folders, mail folders, and calendars. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/microsoft365dev/microsoft-graph-apis-for-permanent-deletion-of-mailbox-items-now-available

item.title: The return of Building 7
item.description: Pranksters lose one of their longtime inside jokes. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20250401-00/?p=111033

item.title: Exact Nearest Neighbor (ENN) Vector Search for Precise Retrieval
item.description: In applications such as personalized recommendations and scientific research, accurately identifying the closest data points to a given query is crucial. Traditional methods like Approximate Nearest Neighbor (ANN) search offer faster retrieval times by approximating results but may sacrifice accuracy, leading to potential errors in scenarios where precision is essential. This trade-off between speed and [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/cosmosdb/exact-nearest-neighbor-enn-vector-search

item.title: Building AI Applications with Memory: Mem0 and Azure AI Integration
item.description: Learn how to integrate Mem0 with Azure AI Search and Azure OpenAI to create AI applications with persistent memory capabilities across conversations. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/foundry/azure-ai-mem0-integration

item.title: Getting Started with Claude models on Azure Databricks
item.description: Introduction Following up on the exciting announcement about Anthropicâ€™s state-of-the-art models becoming available to Azure Databricks customers, this post provides a detailed, step-by-step guide on how you can start using Claude 3.7 Sonnet model directly within your Azure Databricks environment using Model Serving. Weâ€™ll walk through deploying the necessary Azure Databricks workspace, finding the Claude [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/all-things-azure/getting-started-with-claude-3-7-sonnet-on-azure-databricks

item.title: View and manage git tags
item.description: Are you tired of switching between your IDE and command-line tools to manage Git tags? Weâ€™ve got the perfect solution for you! With the latest update, Visual Studio empowers you to seamlessly view and manage Git tags directly within the Git Repository window. This streamlined workflow ensures you remain within the familiar environment of the [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/view-and-manage-git-tags

item.title: Improve the security of Generation 2 VMs via Trusted Launch in Azure DevTest Labs
item.description: Weâ€™re thrilled to announce the public preview of the Trusted Launch feature for Generation 2 (Gen2) Virtual machines (VMs) in Azure DevTest Labs!Â ğŸŒŸ This game-changing feature is designed to enhance security of virtual machines (VMs), protecting against advanced and persistent attack techniques. Here are the key benefits: Securely deploy VMsÂ with verified boot loaders, OS kernels, [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/develop-from-the-cloud/improve-the-security-of-generation-2-vms-via-trusted-launch-in-azure-devtest-labs

item.title: Building a Model Context Protocol Server with Semantic Kernel
item.description: This is second MCP related blog post that is part of a series of blog posts that will cover how to use Semantic Kernel (SK) with the Model Context Protocol (MCP). This blog post demonstrates how to build an MCP server using MCP C# SDK and SK, expose SK plugins as MCP tools and call [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/semantic-kernel/building-a-model-context-protocol-server-with-semantic-kernel

item.title: SQL Conf() 2025 Highlights: So Much Developer Innovation!
item.description: For decades, SQL Server has been a cornerstone of data management, evolving to meet the needs of modern developers. What began as a traditional relational engine is now a cloud-enabled, AI-integrated platform designed for building real-world applications. SQL Server continues to meet developers where they areâ€”offering tools, services, and capabilities that simplify complexity and support [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/azure-sql/sql-conf-2025-recap

item.title: Azure SDK Release (March 2025)
item.description: Azure SDK releases every month. In this post, you find this month's highlights and release notes. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/azure-sdk/azure-sdk-release-march-2025

item.title: Azure DevTest Labsâ€™ feedback forum has a new home!
item.description: Weâ€™re thrilled to announce that Azure DevTest Labs has joined the Visual Studio Developer Community to collect valuable feedback and suggestions from our customers. ğŸŒŸ This fantastic feedback portal is here to make your experience smoother and more engaging. Itâ€™s your go-to place to connect with the Azure DevTest Labs product and engineering teams to [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/develop-from-the-cloud/azure-devtest-labs-feedback-forum-has-a-new-home

item.title: Microsoft 365 Certification control spotlight: Data retention, back-up, and disposal
item.description: Learn how Microsoft 365 Certification validates data retention, back-up, and disposal controls for Microsoft 365 apps. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/microsoft365dev/microsoft-365-certification-control-spotlight-data-retention-back-up-and-disposal

item.title: On launching a dialog when a specific combo box item is selected
item.description: Changing selections is not a good time to launch a dialog box. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20250327-00/?p=111009

item.title: Using OpenTelemetry for flexible observability
item.description: OpenTelemetry offers flexible observability in distributed systems, this post looks at how to integrate multiple data sources when connected and disconnected from the internet. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/ise/using-opentelemetry-for-flexible-observability
